Reviews.Title: “worst stay here. Never rent from here”
Reviews.Author: Haley e
Reviews.Content: My friend and i came here on Thursday March 15th. We were coming for St Patricks parade. We were on a budget so a high class hotel was out of the question. We found Hotel "Elegant" online. So we looked at the pictures online and thought it would be a decent place. We knew we wouldnt get something gorgeous but at least something sleepable... Anyways to make a long story short, we arrived the woman at the front desk was not plesent there was this old man always walking around looking and inspecting everything all the time.. The place smelt like old wet carpets. The beds were hard like a rock, The room was extremely HOT even with the window open. The servide was terrible down stairs. The vending machine was empty and not refilled through the whole 4 days we stayed here.. There was VERY loud people next door to the point where they bang on the wall cuz they were wrestling and my head actually bounced off the wall. I think they let anyone in the building.. And the location where the hotel is, its very scarey.. It look like a dump from outside.. The Pictures online that they have dont even match what the have in the rooms. The only thing that is actuallyi n the room that you see online is the blanket.. And that feels like plastic..

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: caribechick
Reviews.Content: Is this a 5 star hotel no.. is this a rat hole hotel.. no.. its a good value for your time in montreal. ITs 2 blocks from Rue Ste-Catherine which is both the Gay Village and the shopping downtown area. Walking distance to it all... the streets are short so its not that bad of a walk.. Its close to all the clubs like 6 or 7 blocks and a 20 min walk to Vieux Montreal (Old Montreal) Coras is the Ihop of canada and its like 5 blocks away. Rue Ontario has alof of the straight bars and a few good places to eat too which is a block away. The room is standard. queen size bed, fridge which was nice, and a clean bathroom. The from desk staff isn't all that nice or friendly but if you ask them questions they will answer anything you need. For 5 days 4 nights we paid a little over 300 and i think thats a deal ... If you don't want to park on the street for whatever reason ( people on here are way to scared of things... i live in new and its the same thing has parking here. ) ITs actually pretty safe and thats including walking back to the hotel at 3am slightly buzzed... but if you are still scared someone is going to do something to your car (not going to happen) accross the street is a parking lot daily is 20$ and around the corner there is one also didn't park there ... after the first day i parked on the street and actually avoided paying for parking most of the time. All in all great experience for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value downtown and dog-friendly too”
Reviews.Author: chasinchelsea
Reviews.Content: I heard about this hotel through a dog-travel site. They don't charge for pets (I'm totally fed up with hotels that charge ridiculous amounts to keep a dog) and set aside the ground floor rooms for their owners. The only problem is that there's hardly a blade of grass on the street but there is a rather nice park about two blocks away for dog walking. I stayed for one night and the room was a pretty good size. It was clean enough but it smelled heavily of pine-scented disinfectant when I arrived (which I mentioned to the manager the next day); fortunately the windows open. This is not The Ritz by any means, but for $87 including all taxes and garage parking ($12) it's good enough for overnight. The desk clerk on duty probably could have been a little more interested and courteous. The hotel itself is very close to the bus station but noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Montreal stay for less”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: I paid $160 (all taxes inclided) for a two-night stay in a room with one queen-size bed. Location, location, location, as they say. I was within walking dinstance from everything: old Montreal, shopping, fine restaurants and more... Don't like the breakfast? There is Cora's Breakfast within 1,5 kms (20 minute walk) from the hotel. Wi-Fi too slow? Unless you are on YouTube or download movies, you'll find Internet connection pretty reasonable Parking lot is too far? I paid $21 and could drive in and out for 3 days without paying extra. It was only 5 minutes away from the hotel. Lazy to walk? Park across the street but the rates won't be as flexible. My gf and I stayed in room 311, which faced townhomes and was fairly quiet. Nothing outrageous during our 3 day 2 night stay. There wasn't much space for luggage. This room is suitable for those with minimum luggage: we travelled with 1 gym bag, 1 back pack and a small suit case and everything fit right by our bed. I am not gonna bother commenting on panhandlers and such. This is downtown Montreal. Enough said. Tip #1: if your room is too cold or too hot, try playing with the duct on the ceiling. That smoke-detector looking thing is actually your hvac duct. You can open or close it by twisting. Tip # 2: everytime you think something could have been better, just think how much you paid for your stay. This is a bargain hotel and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NoFixedPlans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Elegant for 3 nights over the Easter weekend. On the upside, the staff is friendly and the location is great; close to Old Montreal, Crescent Street, shopping on St. Catherine and good restaurants. The rooms are fine; large and fairly clean. The breakfast is basic - coffee, tea and packaged croissants. There is no issue with having to use a code to get in at night as other reviewers have said - there's someone on the desk 24 hours to let you in. Secure parking across the street for $12/day. A few complaints: one morning we had no hot water in the shower and on our last night were woken up at 3 am by drunken people in the hallways coming home from the bars. They advertise free internet but it does NOT work in most parts of the hotel, so if this is important to you, be warned. All in all, exactly what we expected for $50 per night for a double room with breakfast. You can't beat that price in downtown Montreal. Recommended - if you want a cheap central room, just to sleep and leave your stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about staying here”
Reviews.Author: Munichs-canadalovers
Reviews.Content: We book the hotel just for one night, because our preferred B&B for the next night. Bad choice!! It was one night too long! First of all the whole property was totaly different from all the positive reviews. Hard to believe it was built in 2007 it was shabby, dirty and offered a horro-movie-motel like athmosphere. In our room there were suspicious black AND white spots all over the carpet and blankets. The bathroom was covered in (pubic) hair. The toilett was sprinkeled with dots in rainbow colours and smelt disgusting. We are two student girls and we did not feel save in the area arround. When you walk down the street you can meet junkies, drug dealers, prostitutes and homeless people begging money from you. Avoid the park!!!!!! As we decided not to stay in this room over night, because we were deeply concerned about our health and safty and were too tired after a long day of the travel to pull an allnighter, the hotel staff was not even close to be friendly. The hotel mangeger was not avaliable and we were asked to come back the following day to ask for the refund of our money, since we didn't stay in this room for more than 10 min in total!! The next morning he refused to talk to us in reasonable way. And screened and pointed his finger at us and we would waste his time. We didn't get our money back!! We would also like to mention that we have a lot of travel experience and therefore do have realistic views on accomodation also in this price segment. But being treated rudely and being put into a disgustingly dirty cell is not an option. If your wellbeing is important to you don't even think about staying at this "Hotel"! Don't let this place ruin your time in the great city of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel with caution”
Reviews.Author: LouLufc
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Elegant in Montreal for the Formula 1 weekend. We booked this place for 2 very clear reasons: firstly the location of the hotel in relation to the circuit and we were on a budget. The hotel ticked both boxes, it is a short walk to the Beri metro station and then 1 tube stop to the circuit, it is also very economical at a time when hotel room prices in the city are very high. My advice is to be very clear why you are choosing this hotel. We booked 3 rooms, 1 was a dingly, hot basement room, one had a flea ridden bed and the third was freezing as the staff on reception controlled the air con - not the guest in the room. The staff were not very friendly, it was very noisy with pipes creaking and it was a very, very poor breakfast. Read all reviews of this hotel carefully and book with your eyes wide open.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay very clean, very safe.”
Reviews.Author: gypsySt_paulMn_
Reviews.Content: everything a+ ,clean,safe, friendly, good service, close to bus depot and main subway station. laundry closeby, good resturants minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump.”
Reviews.Author: Marko56
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I am easy to please so don't get the idea I am a complainer. This joint is a dump. You can see through the towels. There is nowhere to put your bags. Breakfast is a cold croissant or a muffin (only one per guest). The streets surrounding are full of beggars. On the up side though, you can walk to the corner and get on the metro to the city.

Reviews.Title: “fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: craicnceol
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Montreal. I was there for business but extended my trip to enjoy the city for few extra days. I stayed at hotel elegant. I was a little disappointed when I arrived as it wasn't very solubrious. However the rooms were clean and attebded every day and the location was good too. Just across the road from Metro and bus station so was convenient for getting around. Also right in middle of the action for Just for Laughs festival which was on while I was there. Overall, good value for money but if you want something a bit special, try elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Not Awful”
Reviews.Author: MandaD
Reviews.Content: We paid less than we would for a hostel. The room was fine, nothing special but we paid less than 50 dollars a night between us and you get a pastry and a cup of coffee in the morning

Reviews.Title: “not too bad really”
Reviews.Author: rrobertson11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our reservations were lost at Celebrities hotel on St. Denis. At first we were not too happy about the location, but it was right up the street from a St Catharines ( great shopping/ food/ bars on this street) . We were 20 minutes ( walking) from Old Montreal, and about 10 minutes from any shopping malls and restaurants. we didn't have much of a view due to the construction going on, but my room was clean and the staff was very pleasant. You do have to buzz in after 10 p.m. Sophie was working when we arrived and she helped us find a great place to relax and unwind after our slightly upsetting start to our vacation. it was called the Les 3 Brasseurs ( the three brothers). Breakfast was not fantastic, croissants, muffins, coffee and juice, but not horrible either. some cereal or fresh fruit would have been great. all in all, we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “The worst that I ever stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: Ehdison
Reviews.Content: This is the crapiest and dirtiest place (I don't even want to mention the word 'hotel') I ever stayed. The room and corridor was pot and smoke smell; dirty and stinky. The bed was rough and hair on the sheets. The worst was the next morning no hot water and the explanation was the crapiest. I think the hotel is owned by Indian people (family business) and even the staff was bad. The bad part was when we enter the reception, a guy, looks like a homeless, was asking for room(no joke); he was that dirty, and the receptionist told that they were full; it seems that the hotel is mostly occupied by these types of people (but personally, I was wondering if they can afford even that cheap price) In any case, I recommend anyone to avoid this place; in any means unless like I said if you are a person can accept the pot smell and other dirty things. We had to wash all the clothes including our bags when we reach home because; the smell stayed; I'm not joking and I had enough trouble with my wife for booking this room. Lesson learned in a hard way!

Reviews.Title: “Never Book This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: feelgooduproar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Elegant is hands down THE worst hotel in all of Canada. It is an absolutely revolting establishment with no regard for it's customers. I had the worst stay I've ever had anywhere. Firstly, when we arrived we found that you have to buzz to get into the hotel, and were subsequently locked outside in the cold for over twenty minutes. The excuse for this was that the receptionist couldn't hear us buzzing, knocking, calling or yelling. Then there were Hotel Elegant's rules; which include no visitors after 10 pm, no alcohol, and no outside food. This place is more like your mother-in-law's than a hotel. The rooms themselves are even worse. There are stains literally everywhere, and in four days of stay our sheets and towels were never changed once. And the free highspeed wireless internet they advertise? It requires an ethernet cord. Don't bother waking up for the continental breakfast either. It's quite literally canned orange juice, muffins from the grocery, and cheap tea. All of which, is quite obviously bought weeks in advance and tastes incredibly stale. The staff is what tops this place off. They all act extremely snobbish and turn any small complaint you make into a lecture on how you should be glad the hotel is so cheap. (And by the way, their prices fluctuate on how much they want to extort you, as we discovered when a friend came to get a room for the night and got the exact same room we booked for twenty dollars less) Lastly, and this really takes the cake, on our last night's stay we found a pair of dirty, red boxershorts underneath one of our beds. These shorts did not belong to any of us. If I were you, I'd take my money and go down the street to the Comfort Inn where it might be a tiny bit more expensive but at least your sheets are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean, Quiet, Cheap Room”
Reviews.Author: jr02gm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Elegant with my spouse just for one evening. The price was right (very inexpensive), the room was very clean, and the staff very pleasant. The style of the room is a bit out-dated, but it has all the basics (except an alarm clock but you could get a wake up call). It's definitely very low key, but if you are just looking for a nice quiet place to rest your head after site-seeing and don't plan on spending much time in the hotel, it's just the right place. Also, it included a yummy continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bathroom!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catdog27
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel on Hotwire.com and having used the website several times before with good results was not at all worried, untill we arrived. Hotel Elegant was not elegant at all. Our bathroom was filthy, scum all around the sink, the toilet was covered in pubic hair and dirt, it clearly hadn't been cleaned properly for some time. And the bathtub was stained with dirt. The room had no heating, which in winter is not great, the room was really cold. We are currently backpacking around the world on a budget so our standards are not that high with regards to accomadation, but how hard is it to clean a toilet.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Ozarka3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is anything but "elegant." I have been in Motel 6s with more charm and grace. Tacky, tacky, tacky from the lobby and front desk to the rooms. The entire place reminded me more of a youth hostel than a hotel. For instance there was a crudely made sign with no frame even tacked to the wall, saying no visitors after 10 pm. The rooms were small and very cheaply and poorly furnished. Wireless internet ended up needing a wire. Also there was a crappy, crappy attitude on the part of the staff....very rude and obnoxous. Stay here only if you are desperate. This place bills itself as three-star but probably doesn;t even deserve one star.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !!!”
Reviews.Author: YvonneRoma
Reviews.Content: On the way back to Toronto , coming from QuÃ©bec we stayed one night in Hotel Elegant in MontrÃ©al. Despite we had read some positive reviews o this hotel prior to book, we were very badly impressed by this Hotel that is not at all "Elegant" like its name . At the front Desk we had the sensation having disturbed the guy who was "working"(?) on Internet. The darkness of the corridors leading to the rooms looked like those of a Hospital and the "grey doors" had something disquieting. The room was very basic , and the bathroom was dirty. We found some papers under the wash basin and the most disgusting were some blood traces on the hair drier itself, on the wall were the hair drier was located and on the hair dried cable . We assumed someone had successfully tried to kill mosquitoes. To conclude our experience in this Hotel, we asked the front desk guy if it was possible to have breakfast around 06:30 a.m. since we had to leave early to Toronto, but the guy answered this was not possible before 07:30 a.m. ... not even a cup of coffee! We were therefore obliged to stop later at a Motel on the road despite we had breakfast included in the rate we paid..

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prncs365
Reviews.Content: We originally booked another hotel which ended up having an emergency plumbing issue so the staff booked in this place which was slightly more expensive. The hotel I originally picked was cheap and kinda cute. This new place was across from the Greyhound bus station and Metro and more on a busy street. I liked Saint Denis street better. The rooms were sort of like the Days Inn with minimal furniture, hard bed and a smoking room. We were advised by the staff that parking on the street could be done (plenty of spots) but not to leave anything visible. That implied statement made me sort of wonder about the neighborhood but being with two other girls and near the Metro stop we had a blast and made it work. I am sorry I had to pay 89 a night but we weren't there that long to really have to stare at it. The staff was pretty nice and knew English. The room was clean and not complicated and everything worked. If you want a budget hotel this would be fine but don't expect to be waited on like the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: CeeGunn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Elegant is advertised as a "new construction", and that is certainly true. The furniture & fixtures appear new, but that's not to say they are nice. It seems as if many things were purchased very cheaply: small & scratchy towels, 1-ply toilet paper, thin bed coverings, TV with a remote that never worked. However, the hotel was clean, the beds firm & comfy, and the pillows fluffy. The bathroom was small but adequate, which also describes the tiny shampoo packets. Having an elevator was a nice extra; having no temperature control in the room...not so nice. On the plus side: we loved that there was a mini-fridge in the room and a super-powered hair dryer in the bathroom. One of our least favourite things about this hotel: no parking lot. I realize this is not unusual for the Latin Quarter, but it was unexpected to us. The parking space we were given was a block & a half away, underneath the library, AND we had to pay for it! The hotel staff were always polite and friendly, and spoke English. We did not try the free breakfast, but it was available between 8am and 10am. The location of the hotel disturbed us at first. There is a large construction project going on directly across the street, and the bus station is right behind that. Several undesirable locals often loitered around the area, and we were approached by a beggar within seconds of exiting our hotel. But we soon grew accustomed to the "feel" of the area, including the lively "Village" district just south of the hotel on Saint Catherine street. And a short walk to the west was St Denis street, with its fantastic array of food & drink & night-life. We also found it quick & easy to reach the Metro (at Maissonneuve & Berri) which is the best way to get around Montreal. (All day Tourist passes are $9.) All in all, a decent hotel for the price. Fair enough place to crash after a long, wonderful day spent exploring beautiful Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel, decent location but neighborhood can be a little questionable”
Reviews.Author: jewelnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new and very, very clean. It is a good economy budget hotel that has the bare basics, but you are getting good, clean accomodations and service for the cheaper price. The room had a telephone, tv, closet area, big window and full bathroom. There is wireless internet access if you have a computer. Some rooms have mini fridges, but because the hotel is newer they have not finished putting them in every room yet. There is VERY limited parking in the back of the hotel, but a nearby parking lot charges $7 CAD a day. The hotel provides a small breakfast daily (big muffin or croissant, jelly, tea or coffee, glass of OJ) and has a couple drink vending machines. The location in regards to being near exciting/tourist-friendly parts of Montreal is good, but the street itself looks like it may sometimes get sketchy. The street is full of budget hotels and new constructions. We were there during the jazz festival, so the people around the street were okay for the most part, but it definitely looks like the late night crowd during an off season or certain week nights could be very questionable. Still, it is close to the subway, St Catherine and St Denis (exciting streets with stores and nightlife), a 20 - 30 minute walk from McGill and Mount Royal, and a 15 minute walk from the jazz festival and underground mall. The only downside is that the walls are pretty thin, so if there are noisy guests nearby you will probably be able to hear them. We could occassionally hear showers running in adjacent rooms, but enjoyed our stay well enough nonetheless.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Elegant
HotelInfo.Address: 1683 Rue Saint-Hubert, Montreal, Quebec H2L 3Z1, Canada
